info.question: ______ lets you give your users access to AWS resources after they have successfully authenticated with a web-based identity provider like Amazon, Facebook, or Google
Following successful authentication, the user receives an authentication token from the Web ID provider, which they can trade for ______
Cognito provides web identity federation with which of these features?
answers: sign-up and sign-in to your apps
acts as an identity broker between your app web ID providers, so you do not need to write any additional code
synchronizes user data for multiple devices
recommended for all mobile applications which run on AWS services
recommended for all AWS services access
correctAnswer: sign-up and sign-in to your apps
acts as an identity broker between your app web ID providers, so you do not need to write any additional code
synchronizes user data for multiple devices
recommended for all mobile applications which run on AWS services

info.question: Cognito is the recommended approach for ______ using social media accounts like Facebook
Cognito brokers between your app and Facebook or Google to provide ______ which map to an IAM role allowing access to the required resources
Cognito allows you to get which two of these benefits?
answers: no need for your app to embed or store AWS credentials locally on the device
gives a seamless experience across all mobile devices
correctAnswer: no need for your app to embed or store AWS credentials locally on the device
gives a seamless experience across all mobile devices

info.question: User pools are user directories used to manage ______ for mobile and web applications
Users can sign-in directly to the user pool, or indirectly via an ______ like Facebook, Amazon, or Google
Cognito acts as an ______ between the ID provider and AWS
Successful authentication via an identity broker like Cognito generates a number of ______
______ enable you to create unique identities for your users and authenticate them with identity providers
With an identity, you can obtain temporary, limited-privilege AWS credentials to access ______
Cognito tracks the association between user identity and the ______
answers: various different devices they sign-in from
correctAnswer: various different devices they sign-in from

info.question: In order to provide a seamless user experience for your application, Cognito uses ______ user data across multiple devices
answers: push synchronization to push updates and synchronize
pull synchronization to pull updates and synchronize
correctAnswer: push synchronization to push updates and synchronize

info.question: ______ is used to send a silent push notification to all the devices associated with a given user identity whenever data stored in the cloud changes
What are the three different types of IAM policies?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy which is created and administered by AWS?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy provides policies for common use cases based on job function?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy allows you to assign appropriate permissions to your users groups, and roles without having to write the policy yourself?
A single ______ can be attached to multiple users, groups, or roles within the same AWS account and across different accounts
You cannot change the permissions defined in this type of policy
Which type of policy is an IAM policy is a stand alone policy that you create and administer inside your own AWS account?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy can you attach to multiple users, groups, and roles, but only within your account?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy that in order to create it, you can copy and existing AWS managed policy and customize it to fit the requirements of your organization?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy is recommended for use cases where the existing AWS manged policies do not meet the needs of your environment?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy is an IAM policy which is actually embedded within the user, group, or role to which it applies?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy has a strict 1-to-1 relationship between the entity and the policy?
Which type of policy is an IAM policy that when you delete the user, group, or role in which it is embedded, the policy will also be deleted?

Which type of policy is an IAM policy that is useful when you want to be sure that the permissions in a policy are not inadvertently assigned to any other user, group, or role than the one for which they are intended?
